castAddBody.text: gm Farcaster 🧢
11am ET tomorrow 👀

Put on your party hats... Hats Protocol and the Hats App v2 are now live & ready to use! 🥳

Give revocable roles and authorities to your people and code, save time, and get things done.

What makes Hats the ultimate coordination tool? ohhh baby, here we go... 

1/15

WHY HATS

Hats are roles & roles are how people coordinate to get things done 

Why are so many DAOs so chaotic? There are no roles! No roles = no structure = no accountability. The tyranny of structurelessness wins again...

It doesn't have to be like that.

2/15

When roles are clear:
- work is no longer chaotic
- ppl know who to turn to for critical info 
- ppl are empowered to make decisions and take action
- ppl can be held accountable!

Good news! Hats is easy to use, & it composes w/ all the DAO tools you already know and love:

3/15

CONTROL RESOURCES

With Hats you can give contributors all kinds of different revocable (!) onchain & offchain permissions, including:

1.  multisig signing

delegate & revoke multisig signing authority based on specific eligibility criteria (eg JokeRace winners)

4/15

DECISION MAKING

2. Snapshot proposal creation & voting
3. DELV (Element) council voting authority
4. Coordinape circle access

Ensure only the right people can vote and dynamically tie voting eligibility to other conditions

5/15

CHANNELS & WORKSPACES

4. Discord roles & channels CollabLand & Guild
5. Telegram groups
6.  read/comment/write
7.  permissions
8. Google docs

Give ppl all the right permissions w/out any manual on- or offboarding— just mint them a hat!

6/15

SO MUCH MORE

9. EOA wallet ownership (yes, hat-controlled wallets)
10. many more web2 permissions via Lit Protocol
11-100. literally anything that's token-gateable

ahhhhhhh we're composinggggg

7/15

Imagine...

You can even hold a JokeRace that automatically gives the winners special authorities like multisig signing, voting rights & more

Once the election term ends, or if the winners become losers, the hat & its associated authorities are *automatically* revoked

8/15

HOW HATS WORKS

Role-based governance is the future, and Hats bundles all the things roles need: responsibility, authority, accountability

How does Hats empower orgs to ensure the right ppl & addresses always have the right permissions? 

4 steps. It's really quite simple.

9/15

HOW TO BRING YOUR ROLES ONCHAIN

Step 1. Create roles 🧢

Step 2. Connect power to roles ⚡️

Step 3. Customize logic for how the role will be issued, revoked & deactivated 🤝

Step 4. Mint hat tokens to any Ethereum or L2 addresses: EOAs, Safes, DAOs & smart contracts 🤠

10/15

Orgs can be decentralized AND have the structures and accountabilities they need to get things done

Hats enables orgs to create CAPTURE-RESISTANT structures to get shit done (safely)

11/15

https://hats.mirror.xyz/sZjE4zm3jwV9pwUoiqkfbQzabTlWYcdTQqN46iiLkyw

This is why Hats composes w/ Tally Governor contracts, DAOhaus Moloch v3 &  DAOs to enable DAOs to delegate revocable roles to specific people & groups

Hierarchy is no longer the enemy when the top of the hierarchy is the DAO itself

12/15

Interested in trying Hats?

Get a free consultation with one of the founders here: https://hatsprotocol.typeform.com/usehats

Hats is currently deployed to Ethereum,     and Goerli, and will be wherever DAOs are

13/15

Or you can use Hats directly via the app -- Hats is permissionless and open-source!

Use Hats at app.hatsprotocol.xyz
See the new website at www.hatsprotocol.xyz
Visit our docs and guides at docs.hatsprotocol.xyz 
And get in touch if you need help getting started

14/15

If you're inspired by Hats, please like & retweet this thread to help us get the word out. We love our hatvocates! 

And give us a follow to stay tuned for the launch of the Hats protoDAO in t-minus 1 month... 👀

Hold on to your hats, lots more to come... https://warpcast.com/hatsprotocol/0xcb4a95

For the colectooooors out there, here is a collectible Mirror version of this thread:

https://hats.mirror.xyz/NXJI4Rkk4TafwLvVZLfdlz-sLWdrNlKFmvJq9cKDkiw

Heard about Hats but not sure how to get started?

Go from idea to deployed hats in minutes at http://app.hatsprotocol.xyz [desktop only]

Here's how:

1/10

STEP 1: CREATE A NEW TREE 🌲
- Visit http://app.hatsprotocol.xyz [desktop only]
- Connect your wallet
- Click "Create a new tree" (hats are organized in trees)
- Add an image, name & description
- Click "Create"

You're now the proud wearer of your very own top hat!

2/10

This top hat is the first hat you will create; you can think of it as the superadmin of the entire hats tree.

Now you can build out the rest of your tree with Edit Mode...

3/10

STEP 2: BUILD OUT & DEPLOY YOUR NEW TREE 🏗️
- Select "Edit Tree"
- Create new hats
- Add images and details to those hats (and don't forget to click "Save")

Edit mode lets you create whatever role structure you can dream up

4/10

Once you're done building out your tree, click "Deploy". Your hats tree is now onchain!

You can also export a .json of the tree changes or copy an executable hex code to execute the changes via a multisig or share your proposed changes with others

5/10

STEP 3: CONNECT HATS TO POWERS ⚡️

You can now connect your hats with authorities by plugging them into token-gates

Hat (1155 token) + gate = token-gated authority

See the docs for a full list of hat-gateable authorities: https://docs.hatsprotocol.xyz/using-hats/connecting-hats-with-authorities

6/10

STEP 4: ADD WEARERS 🤠

Lastly, you can mint your hats to wearers!

Add addresses individually or via a CSV, and select "Mint Hats"

Hats tokens can be held by any address including an EOA, multisig, or contract

7/10

That's it, you've now created your very first Hats tree and brought your roles onchain! 🥳

You can always continue to add to your tree or invite others to build out the tree with you, as wearers can create additional child hats to delegate responsibility further

8/10

LEVEL UP YOUR TREE W/ ELIGIBILITY 💪

You can now add eligibility criteria (eg wallet holdings, staking, or election results) to dynamically determine which addresses are eligible to wear a hat & to revoke the hat if the wearer is no longer eligible

9/10

Create your hats tree for free at http://app.hatsprotocol.xyz

For guides on all the above and more see the docs: http://docs.hatsprotocol.xyz

And if you need help getting started, book an onboarding call here: https://hatsprotocol.typeform.com/usehats

Happy hatting! 🧢

10/10

Hats are roles. When roles are linked together they create structures that you can use to supercharge your organization.

This unlocks a whole new design space...

FORKABLE HATS TEMPLATES! 🧢

Here are 4 Hats templates you can fork today:

https://hats.mirror.xyz/L1848Q1Dr9nNc4PpQgc5Cay7GkbIv0ssQQDVHcqd1mM

TODAY IS THE DAY — Hats protoDAO has launched! 💥

This is a major step in our commitment to decentralizing the governance & operations of Hats Protocol 🌀

Here's a short post on
- what the protoDAO is all about 🌿
- how to get involved 🧢

https://hats.mirror.xyz/novgFmPfRzlHsJ2StKvQV48lh0CKHMLxeCBgMerrqEs

The dream of composability is alive inside Hats protoDAO!

There are so many incredible composable tools for collectively managing an organization

And Hats is what ties it all together 🧢

Here are the ones we're already using:

👇

https://hats.mirror.xyz/GsijlX80eeRgSHEcEKWKvL5kiinqLShvMZsBCbQuYaw

Today we are launching Hats Modules!

This is the most impactful release we've shipped since the protocol itself, and it's already catalyzing a new era for programmable organizations

Here's why:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8-qRpypY83U&ab_channel=HatsProtocol

Hats Modules tl;dr

🧢 Modules are programmable extensions for roles

⚡ Automate granting and revocation of roles and permissions based on specific conditions

🦾 Discover open-source modules or create your own!

🌀 Available in any app via the Modules Registry and SDK
Here's the full post with everything you need to get started using and building Hats Modules: https://hats.mirror.xyz/xAk_yb7dDL1OLBx8nq47Ni7V1SuiC6L6B-49u7vz520

new channel who dis

🧢
🫡

Hats can be thought of as a “role-in-a-box”

With your hat, you get everything you need to do great work
Hats are roles. And roles bundle the responsibilities, authorities, and accountabilities necessary to get shit done.
Roles are the fundamental unit of structure in any organization

Role-bound, not soul-bound

Separating roles from souls allows the collective to effectively coordinate the work without having power over its members

3 common ways people are using Hats:

1. ELECTIONS: automatically grant permissions based on election results

2. ORG-CONTROLLED MULTISIGS: delegate & revoke signing authority

3. COMMUNITY MANAGEMENT: automate onboarding, offboarding, & cross-platform permissioning

All forkable
https://hats.mirror.xyz/L1848Q1Dr9nNc4PpQgc5Cay7GkbIv0ssQQDVHcqd1mM

Here’s why we’re bringing roles onchain:
- Transparency
- Legibility
- Automatable permissions
- Composability
- Permissionless development
- Infinite programmability

DAOs are dead.

Long live DAOs.

Do you ever find yourself
- manually managing your community,
- tracking permissions,
- onboarding/offboarding members,
- logging addresses in spreadsheets…?

You can Hats that

It's hattening — the first ever Hats Protocol Demo Day!

Join us to check out the future of onchain organizing, presented by a diverse set of orgs using Hats in innovative ways.

Demos include:

1. Permissionless role advancement based on community reputation, from 
ATXDAO

2. Elected roles using Hats + oSnap + Snapshot, from 
Premia Finance

3. An 'evolutionary grants game' built w/ Hats designed to optimize capital deployment within the Arbitrum ecosystem, from DAO Masons

4. Autonomous World Machine: curating decentralized AI datasets using Mochi + Hats + JokeRace + CollabLand

5. CharacterSheets: an RPG dedicated to chronicling guild member journeys leveraging Hats to provision game permissions & roles, from 
RaidGuild

6. Hats Composer, the first AI-enabled Hats tool that uses an LLM to build onchain organizational structures including Hats Trees, Safe multisigs, and Moloch v3 contracts all deployed from a unified UI, from Sobol

7. Hats protoDAO: simplified onboarding and offboarding of community members via automated permission management across multiple platforms including Telegram, Charmverse, Snapshot, DeForm, and DAOhaus

8. And more soon to be announced

The Season 1 Hats Demo Day is not just a showcase of current onchain structures, but also a platform to inspire new uses of the Hats Protocol in organizational governance and operations

Register here: https://lu.ma/x3oef49w
If we are to truly realize the potential of DAOs, we need to empower the people who make them go

Exactly one week from today...

Hats Demo Day, Season 1 — featuring ATXDAO, Premia Finance, RaidGuild, Sobol, Mochi, Grant Ships, and Hats protoDAO
 
Register below!

🧢
🫡
Register here: https://lu.ma/x3oef49w

Hierarchies and networks aren’t necessarily at odds. It’s just a matter of how to integrate what each structure does best.

Hats gives you the resilience and capture resistance of networks with the implementation chops of hierarchies.

Interested in forking any of these implementations for your own org? Let us know and we'll make it happen

We're back and rolling into 2024 with some exciting news as we compose with our friends in the ecosystem  and Snapshot! We're bringing hat abilities to the forefront to make responsibilities and authorities easily accessible.

(1/6)

Adding  roles for a Hat means you can show rewards for those roles directly in the Hats app! Talk about advanced access. Get to it!

(2/6)

The Guild integration surfaces rewards associated with roles in the hats app for for Github, Discord, and Telegram. If you're utilizing these rewards for Hat based roles, make sure to add your Guild to your top hat so these are displayed automatically for you.

(3/6)

When a Hat in your tree has voting weight via a voting strategy, it will be show with a Snapshot authority card. Easily keep tabs on who has access to vote in which spaces used throughout your organization. No more lost space links!

(4/6)

Get started easily by adding a Hat as a strategy on your space and then add it to your Hats tree by updating the Top Hat with the associated space.

(5/6)

As always, join us in the Community chat if you have any questions about getting started with your own Snapshot and Guild authorities.

https://hatsprotocol.deform.cc/community/

Another batch of features are coming your way in the Hats App! 🧢

What's new? For one, you can now interact with modules & Hats Signer Gates directly in the app. 

Creating programmable roles & delegating revocable  multisig signing authority has never been easer ✍️

1/4

Hats Signer Gate is a powerful new primitive that allows orgs to manage  signers without being signers on the safe

Keep control of your safes while delegating out signing authority to eligible addresses (such as election winners), all from the app

We've also improved in-app support for Hats modules: programmable extensions for roles

Now, when you attach modules to your hats, wearers can take direct action on those modules without writing any code (eg, to instantiate new elections or terms)

https://hats.mirror.xyz/xAk_yb7dDL1OLBx8nq47Ni7V1SuiC6L6B-49u7vz520

Many other quality-of-life improvements have been made as well, including the ability to claim hats on behalf of eligible wearers and richer transaction titles for a hat's event history

Interested in trying Hats? Book a demo here:
https://hatsprotocol.deform.cc/getintouch
